customer_name: Puppies and Reptiles For Parties LLC
site_name: Puppies and Reptiles For Parties LLC

citations.narrative:
At least 5 primary enclosures housing dogs and/or puppies has a moderate amount of rust present that may prevent the
required cleaning and sanitization. Ineffective cleaning and sanitizing of housing enclosures may lead to disease hazards.
Primary enclosures, including its surfaces must be free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and
sanitization, or that affects the structural strength of the surface.

Records were not available to confirm sampling was performed for heartworm and internal parasites on facility dogs.
Although the facility treats for fleas and some internal parasites, there is no written schedule, approved by the
veterinarian, for the facility to follow. Failure to conduct sampling and treatment for parasites and other pests in
accordance with the attending veterinarians approved schedule can expose the animals to increased disease risk and can
delay treatment. The licensee must ensure that sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests (including worms,
coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) are followed in accordance with the schedule approved by the attending veterinarian.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by May 26,2025, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
At least 5 primary enclosures housing dogs and/or puppies has a moderate amount of rust present that may prevent the 
required cleaning and sanitization. Ineffective cleaning and sanitizing of housing enclosures may lead to disease hazards. 
Primary enclosures, including its surfaces must be free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and 
sanitization, or that affects the structural strength of the surface. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Records were not available to confirm sampling was performed for heartworm and internal parasites on facility dogs. 
Although the facility treats for fleas and some internal parasites, there is no written schedule, approved by the 
veterinarian, for the facility to follow. Failure to conduct sampling and treatment for parasites and other pests in 
accordance with the attending veterinarians approved schedule can expose the animals to increased disease risk and can 
delay treatment. The licensee must ensure that sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests (including worms, 
coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) are followed in accordance with the schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by May 26,2025, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
